definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism

sentences.english: He also became embroiled in controversy surrounding the government bail-out of Chrysler.
sentences.chinese: 同时他也因政府保释克莱斯勒而被卷入巨大争议。

sentences.english: After he bail mei after of reproach know blamed may explain beginning splendor.
sentences.chinese: 玥保释梅后责备之，后经荣解释始知错怪梅。

sentences.english: Bail was set at $50, 000, according to the Orange County Business Journal.
sentences.chinese: 据《橘子郡商业报》报道，保释金为五万美元。

sentences.english: Zhu is being held without bond at the Montgomery County Jail.
sentences.chinese: 朱海洋正被关押于蒙哥马利县监狱，并不得保释。

sentences.english: When the crunch-card turns up, a bail-out card offers a way out.
sentences.chinese: 出现“紧缩”牌时，“保释”牌排忧解围。

sentences.english: They were bailed out by Banksy, the British artist, in February.
sentences.chinese: 今年2月他俩由英国的艺术家Banksy保释出狱。

sentences.english: Don't have yourlover bail you out on a DUI charge.
sentences.chinese: 受到醉驾指控后，不要让你的情人将你保释。

sentences.english: But Asia is still in custody and can not be released.
sentences.chinese: 不过亚奥还在拘留中，并且不能保释。

sentences.english: Heavy-duty wire bails offer extra durability for heavy use.
sentences.chinese: 重型丝保释提供额外的耐用性，为大量使用。

sentences.english: He's out on bail and awaiting trial.
sentences.chinese: 他是经保释才得以出来的，正等待案件审判。

sentences.english: She was the only one granted bail.
sentences.chinese: 她是惟一一个准予保释的嫌疑人。

sentences.english: After wen qing to bail pearl, pearl mother more closely monitored.
sentences.chinese: 文清将珍珠保释后，纪母更加严密监控珍珠行动。

sentences.english: Although he knows vibration sources accomplishment Yin rebelled against himself, but still will be bailed out.
sentences.chinese: 振源虽知淑贤背叛本人，但还是将保释出来。

sentences.english: Japanese actress freed on bail, faces drug charge.
sentences.chinese: 日本女演员酒井法子面临吸毒指控，已获保释。

sentences.english: Anne: I forgot to call the bail bondsman.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了打电话给保释担保人。

sentences.english: Mr Lee was released on $5，000 bail and asked to report back to police tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 李先生获准以五千元保释外出，明天再返警署报到。

definition: to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
in custody/to keep sb in detention
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
